label: Headache
discussion_title: Chronic head pain and pressure in left temple and left side of face, loss of cognitive functioning
discussion: Hi all,I have been having 24/7 headaches and pressure in the left side of my head and face now for three and a half years. It feels like my movement is a bit restricted in the left side of my face. For example, when I smile, it feels a bit awkward and like I'm making an unnatural face. Yet, when I have gone to neurologists and they've done all the initial tests like testing the strength of each side of your body and seeing if your face is symmetrical when you smile, I always check out okay. The headaches began as a dull, constant pain and I didn't think much of it; however, the pain persisted and I began to go to doctors and get tests done to try to figure out what was going on. I have been given several antibiotics because I was told I had a sinus infection several times, but the antibiotics never took away the pain. I have gotten my sinuses checked and scanned, and everything checked out ok after taking the antibiotics, but the pain and pressure continued. I recently went to an allergist and he swabbed my nose and said that he found bacteria indicative of a sinus infection on the swab, so now for the fourth time I am going to be tried on an antibiotic- Clindamycin this time, whereas in the past it was always Augmentin. In the last 6 months, I have experienced changes in my cognitive functioning along with these headaches. It has become harder for me to think- I now do everything slower because it is very hard to focus and my thinking is sluggish. It is sometimes hard for me to remember things. Sometimes people will be talking and I just can't process in my mind what they are saying. Also, it seems that when my head is hurting more and/or when there is more pressure in my head, my OCD- type thoughts seem to flare up more (my OCD thoughts look like this- I think a bad thought when I am doing a certain action, therefore I have to repeat the action and think something different, and if I don't repeat the action, I believe something catastrophic is going to happen to me). I have gotten an MRI and CAT scan and both are normal. I have gotten many blood tests, tested for lyme disease, all have been negative.Just posting here to see if anyone has had a similar experience of passing all of the tests while still having very real chronic head and face pain and pressure along with some loss in cognitive functioning and OCD.

discussion_title: Headache when lightly touching left temple area
discussion: Hello! For about a week, I've been having a strange headache. Overall, when I'm sitting, standing, walking, or doing something else nothing is bothering me, however I do feel some pressure coming from the back of my head. When I lightly touch my left temple area, I feel pain which seems to be coming from behind of my left ear inside of my head. If I push on my left temple instead of barely touching it, I don't feel any pain at all. It only appears when I lightly touch my left temple area. I don't have any problems with my speech, hearing, vision, or balance. I don't feel dizzy either. I'm eating and sleeping very well. I do feel some pressure in my head though - it's very light with no pain. It seems like it's pressing on my eyes and nose area from the inside, but again, very light. The symptoms that I feel did not get better or worse since the headache started a week ago. I did have a stress recently, and the weather has been changing from hot to freezing temperatures. I've always reacted to weather, but the nature of my weather-related headaches is absolutely different from what I'm experiencing now. I'm a 32 year old female, and I've always considered myself healthy. My mom has had headaches as long as I remember - they are often related to weather conditions, neck and blood pressure issues. I'm not taking any medications except for oral contraceptives for about 6 years.Has anyone had the symptoms like I described? discussion_title: Headache for a month scared it's a tumour
discussion: I am a 37 year old female who has been suffering with a headache for a month now. I went to emergency and they did a few tests like looking in my eyes with a light, making me push his hands with both my feet and a few other things. By doing these few tests he said it was 99% not a tumour. But it's 3 weeks later and I still have the headache. Over the counter medications do work until they are out of my system then it's back. It's not as bad as I here migraines are it's not that painful it's just annoying. Everyone is telling me it's stress or my eyes which I'm getting my eyes tested Wednesday but I think it's something serious. The pain is behind my eyes and the front of my head some times it's my whole head. When I'm laying down is when it pretty much goes away but there is still sometimes a shooting pain. Yes I've been under stress the last while but it doesn't feel like that type headache. Could the doctor be able to tell from those few tests weather it's really a tumour or not? I've never been more scared in my life thinking this is a tumour. I have no other symptoms just the slight headache. When I wake up its not there sometimes it's not there till afternoon. In the month that I've had it there was at least 7 days in between that it went away and when it came back my panic is back. Could it actually be chronic tension headaches or something none life threatening? Is there anyone out there with the same type of headaches or anyone who can reassure me that this isn't a brain tumour or aneurysm please. label: Headache
discussion_title: Headaches for over 3 weeks - One sided, above and behind eye.
discussion: I'm a 19yr old student and I've had a constant dull pain above my left eye and behind for over 3 weeks now. The pain was fairly deep (pressure type) behind and on my eye brow - felt like sinus headache and often once a day got very painful to the point were I couldn't function properly.Originally the doctor said it was cluster headaches, however I was then told that it could possibly be my sinuses and was referred to an ENT specialist. I've had ringing in both ears for about 1 year and a popping/fullness in my left ear for about the same period of time. Never suffered from migraines although I have had my fair amount of headaches growing up due to stress, being tired etc. ENT said my problem was not sinuses, she used a camera up my nose to check. Also had hearing test which came back normal although she did say my left ear showed slight congestion or something which makes sense as this is were the popping is. She said the pain is neuropathic and is being caused by inflammation therefore she prescribed me 'Flixonase Nasule drops' to take twice a day for 6 weeks however she said this would take at least 2 weeks to work. I was originally taking a combination of Sudafed, Aspirin and Ibuprofen - Sometimes all togetheror sometimes just a combination of two which worked for about 5 days, with the occasional dose of Codine if needed. This stopped working and the doctor prescribed me 'Diclofenac' 50mg tablets and take 3 a day. This has almost completely taken my pain away with just some niggling pain - sensations sometimes, however this reminds me the problem is still there just being numbed by the inflammatory. Today I've been to the dentist to ensure there was no problems in my mouth. They said I've got wisdom teeth appearing on my left side however everything looks fine and just need to keep my eye on it and she doubts that is the cause of my headaches. Although she did say there is signs I may grind my teeth at night (no major problems) however I could get a mouth piece to wear at night, she said this could be causing headaches but it might be worth leaving it a few months. I've also had a clicking jaw which I've noticed more recently and whenever I eat now I can hear it popping. I'm completely confused as to whats actually wrong with me! Nobody is giving me a proper answer although something is clearly inflamed as diclofenac is working! If there is anybody who has had similar or knows about these things any reassurance would be great as this is bringing me down.Thanks

label: Headache
discussion_title: Weird tingling/numbness on my left side
discussion: Hello!I have been experiencing weird tingling/numbness on my head's left side. I frankly don't know how to describe this feeling I am having but I suppose these words describe it the best. I have been struggling with this weird feeling for quite a few years now but I never paid big attention to it because it was insignificant. Lately the tingliness has increased and is more severe. I usually don't have problems with this feeling but it is hard to fall asleep because I am forced to sleep on my left side. The reason why I have to sleep on the left side is because if I do so, I do not feel it. I can sleep on my right side but only if I put my other hand on my head. Essentially I have to cover the area on my head that has this weird feeling. Now that I experience it more I am very concerned about it. I have no idea what it is related to? I read some related topics but I couldn't find anything that would describe my problem the best. Some say it could be related to anxiety and stress but I don't think that is the case. I have never had a doctor appointment towards this matter.

label: Headache
discussion_title: I’m making myself ill
discussion: I suffer with severe anxiety, and I have accepted that it’s something I am going to have to live with. But for 4 months now I have been getting daily headaches and I have literally convinced myself I have a brain tumour. I wake with a headache everyday, I get dizzy spells and at nighttime I get a numb right leg a bit like pins and needles. The worst thing I can do I know is google my symptoms, but I have. I’ve been to the doctors, dentist and opticians and they have all told me everything seems fine. My doctor has now referred me to a neurologist but the appointment is months away and I don’t know what to do I’m probably worrying over nothing but I don’t know how to stop and it’s probably making things worse! Can anyone give me any reassurance?! I don’t like being left on my own!

label: Headache
discussion_title: Bizarre headache (or something) terrifying me
discussion: I joined the forum just so I could get some possible input. Hello! The last few days I’ve been experiencing something that I honestly don’t know is a headache and it might get a bit lengthy so just bear with me...It started as a headache at night. I passed out early (around 9) but woke up at about 3am and couldn’t get back to sleep til about 9am. Slept for another couple of hrs but that was it. Each time I was awake my headache was progressively getting worse. It was in the front of my head. As the day went on the headache got worse but moved, from the top of my head eventually to the back of it. Took some otc meds like Tylenol, had some caffeine, even tried a couple of my husbands tramodol, nothing helped. By the time 2pm arrived I just layed in bed basically motionless til about 6pm. Not quite napping but closing my eyes and not moving felt best. After this I got up and took a shower, but the ‘headache’ had again morphed. By this time it’s moreso a strange pressure instead of pain, all over my head but more on the sides and in the back, accompanied with tingling and I feel dizzy, and like I’m underwater- I guess. Honestly it felt like I took some bad drugs. I don’t jnow how else to describe it. Almost like a dizzy-ish floating feeling. With also vision slightly fogged, as if there were smoke in the room. Took my shower, water felt both good and strange on my head. Once I get out and get dressed it’s gotten worse. I’m laying down again, my neck is stiff-ish, all my muscles that are usually tight or sore in my neck, shoulder and upper back region are more sore and tighter than normal. I have my husband rub me a bit. Helps for the time being but once he’s done it goes back to how it was. I try a heat pack on my neck, doesn’t help. Now it’s about 9pm, it feels like I’m on some serious drugs, my arms hurt and are a little tingly, my body feels like I’m both under water yet floaty, the pressure in my head is all time high, I feel like my body isn’t working right. Like my arms and legs are heavy, my neck and back hurt like no other, and I’ll get random sharp pain in the back of my head and in the front. I took a shot of espresso, some more Tylenol, and passed out early and slept through the whole night which is very odd for me as I have had insomnia since I was a kid and generally have to take something to fall asleep and actually stay asleep. I woke up this morning feeling slightly better but I can already feel it getting worse again like it did the day before. My neck and upper back and shoulders are tight and hurt, my body feels heavy, my head has weird pressure and it feels like my body and head are swimming. I feel drugged. It makes no sense to me. It’s triggering my anxiety and I can’t help but start to panic. A little bit about me: I’m a 34yo woman. Relatively healthy diet, not overweight or have any underlying health issues that I know of. Have had migraines but I always know when it’s a migraine. This is nothing like I’ve experienced. I suffer from anxiety but again, have had it since I was a kid and know how to manage when it comes up. This is nothing like what I’ve come across. I just recently started dealing with a decaying tooth from where a crown fell off (crooked dentists!!) so of course I started to look up sepsis and freaked myself out. I started taking antibiotics this morning just in case. The stiff neck also made me think meningitis and that also freaked me out. Have I mentioned I’m a hypochondriac? Lol. But seriously. Everything I look up has some features of what I’m experiencing but not quite. I know I shouldn’t self diagnose but the real problem here is I am actually staying in Thailand right now bc my husband is receiving non FDA treatment for a tumor. I don’t have a doctor or that much money, so unless this is an emergency situation I don’t really have the luxury of just going to my clinic or doctor. Does this sound like anything to anyone? I’m really starting to freak out. Any input or ideas is greatly appreciated!

label: Headache
discussion_title: persistant right skull headache (semsitive to sound and light), left leg radiation goes up
discussion: This is Mrityunjay computer science PhD student from India. I get right skull head pressure which starts from near by right ear. Some times I confuse with pain, mean to say, should I call it pain or head pressure. It is sensitive to light and sound. This head pressure is present with me every time(some times more some times less). When I face huge sound and light then it increase. In my left leg, radiation goes from feet to buttock then it goes to my back here and there. There is no weakness through out my body. I do not get proper sleep. I can not sleep chest up position and in my right side(left nostril up position). If I do deep breathing, meditation or exercise which increases breathing rate my head pressure increases. I met to more than one neurologist in my place. I have done two times MRI of head and Cervical spine. I have also gone through EEG test of my brain. Every test was normal. Neurologist have not find anything. I have skin issue like acne in upper arms and in summer days I get white patches on upper arms. I had vitamin D and B12 deficiency but these deficiency has become normal after 1-2 month of milk and 1 month medicines. Neurologist have recommended physiotherapy and psychiatrist. I have gone to physiotherapist and one psychiatrist. But I have not relieved. How to relieve head pressure? Please suggest some thing in this regards.

label: Headache
discussion_title: 6 weeks of constant headaches - no relief / going crazy
discussion: Hi everyone. I'm after some possible insight / advice on what I'm currently going through. I will go through as many symptoms as possible, although I'm aware some might be from something different entirely. I started getting a heavy pressure at the back of my head around 6/7 weeks ago, was primarily at the back and kind of felt like my head had a big weight hanging from the back and someone was pushing hard against my skull from the inside. In the next few days this was accompanied by very frequent and fairly severe headaches. These have now been part of my life for the past 6 weeks. The headaches and pains I get differentiate. Mostly it's a dull throbbing at the back of my head. But recently quite often I get what I can only explain as a very sore burning pain on a small area of my forehead and sides of head. I get pains on both sides although i would probably crown the right side for most pain caused. I do get dizzy when I stand up from a relaxed position and have noticed that my face goes red a lot now, as if I've stepped indoors from cold to boiling. I have no energy to do any exercise and feel constantly fatigued and tired. My sleep isn't great as I wake up a lot through the night (may I add that it's not the headaches that wake me up, they seem non existent as I sleep and for the first half hour in the morning when I awake. But from then on its relentless. Painkillers do jack squat, even co-codomol doesn't touch it when that used to be my saving grace whenever I got a bad head. This is much different to headaches I have had before. Last think as well. I went to watch my football team play today and tried to do a warm up with them. Since then my head ache is worse and my brow and temples feel bruised and tender to touch.I apologise for the length of this but i didn't want to leave much out. I hope someone is able to helps with this as it's wearing me out now... Physically and mentally. Got an MRI on weds but I know results can take a while. Was just hoping for some feedback before hand. Thanks for reading. Take care all. Richard

label: Headache
discussion_title: Heavy headed and feeling numb for 1 week straight
discussion: male, 20 years old.i've been feeling heavy headed and numb for a whole week now and still going... im sleeping alright, sometimes i wake up in the middle of the night but i manage to sleep back. i suffered from anxiety and panic attacks since more than a year and half. but i've never felt like this. btw, im calmer and better at coping with anxiety.a month ago, i made changes in my life, i started sleeping and waking up early, exercising, and meditating daily. these changes are suppose to make me feel better and healthier which i honestly feel. but suddenly this weird feeling in my head accompanied with numbness and feeling detached stroke me, i've never felt this before although im used to be more stressed and overworked than this.*phyisically: headaches in different areas of the head, burning headache feeling, heavy head feeling not painfull but very uncomfortable, feeling tired.*emotionally: numb, my short memory seems a bit off (it maybe just a feeling), i dont feel "sharp" and alive as im used to be. i talk and laugh but it doesn't taste as good as it was, it's very strange.i don't smoke, i don't drink, i don't take any medication, i sleep okay, i try to eat healthy. im hopefull and positive, i just want to know what is this and what should i do.i don't know if this is blood sugar related, or blood pressure related, or a virus, or nothing but anxiety? that being said, which kind of doctor should i see? and what tests are needed first?thank you in advance for your answers. wish you the best!

label: Headache
discussion_title: Headache for twelve days, with other symptoms
discussion: So about 12 days ago, I? got a headache on my right side that was close too my temples and the top of my forehead but every once in a while I’d feel a throb on the left side as well, as if someone was sliding it across my forehead. and I? do have a family history of migraines and I’ve had them here and there so I? wasn’t too concerned. I? ended up Laying in the dark for a few hours and it hadn’t got better so I? got up too shower and then ready for bed. During that time, the Pain subsided a bit. I? went too bed and woke up the next morning and the headache had come back, that whole day I? couldn’t get out of bed or even use electronic devices because it hurt too much, I? tried to keep a positive attitude so when my boyfriend got home from work we started watching tv but I? was still in pain too the point I? couldn’t get up, then around time too sleep I? was fine for a few minutes, this continued into into the next day except that night it was worse than it had ever been before, it literally felt like my head was going too explode and I? kept smelling these horrible smells that my boyfriend could not, eventually I? showered and went to bed. The next day the headache was a bit better but not gone, so I? made the decision too visit urgent care, which is up the street but I? could barely drive because I? was unable too focus or think straight, the doctor said I? have sinusitis and prescribed me antibiotics. I? hadn’t noticed any other sinusitis symptoms other than a headache but I? didn’t really care as long as it would make me feel better. I’ve finished the antibiotics, and while the headache has subsided a tiny bit it’s definately still there and about 3 days ago I? was feeling extremely nauseated any eating or drinking felt like I? would throw up, even gagging at some points. I never threw up, but this has continued the past few days. I’ve lost total interest in most of my daily activities and simple tasks have become incredibly difficult due to the fatigue this has caused. Along with that my body has just been feeling weird. Like hard too move, and almost not there. I? do know these are all symptoms of migraines but last night something strange happened. I was sitting on the couch talking with my boyfriends roomate, and suddenly I? felt this like pinching pain inbetween my right shoulder and neck, and with movement it would shoot up the back of my head, so I basically was unable to move my neck altogether. it kept getting worse and apparently all of the sudden I? just blanked, completely stopped talking and curled into a weird position staring off into space, then my boyfriends roomate started talking to me again and I? could understand what he was saying but none of it was computing right, at this point I’d sat myself up but still felt unable too move, as if something was compressing my entire body, I? knew that I? could move if I? tried but it felt like it was impossible. still in that dazed state, my boyfriends roomate said something about my favorite movie and I? just burst into tears and sat there crying just staring into space, then having these intense moments of laughter. I? was talking but the things I? said we’re kind of odd, and there were long pauses where I? was thinking between my words. This lasted probably 15 -25 minutes before I? stood up went too the bathroom and sat on the couch again, at this point I? was Feeling coherent I? was siting on my phone just browsing the internet but everything around me felt blank, like my boyfriend and his roomate were conversing next too me and every once in a while they’d get my attention and rather than speaking I’d just mumble because putting out words was too much work. And my left hand just felt odd, it moved fine but it felt like it wasn’t there. I? went and fell asleep for two hours and reawoke with intense chest & lower jaw pain that hurt too move or breath. This morning I? woke up the neck pain is gone, I? still feel a little weird, and a little bit of pain is still in my chest. And the incident from last night almost feels as if it did not happen I? do not smoke, drink, or have caffeine, I’m pretty healthy. And I? also could not be pregnant. wondering if anyone else had similar experiences, And what it turned out to be or if it jsht happens to be from the sinusitis. also I? do have arthritis in my lower back but I? visit chiropractors and take physically therapy too manage the pain, I’m 19.So about 12 days ago, I? got a headache on my right side that was close too my temples and the top of my forehead but every once in a while I’d feel a throb on the left side as well, as if someone was sliding it across my forehead. and I? do have a family history of migraines and I’ve had them here and there so I? wasn’t too concerned. label: Headache
discussion_title: Headache for a year that isn't going away
discussion: So this is going to be lengthy so beware….So I am a 16 year old female who has been dealing with a constant headache for over a year now. So how it started was back in November of 2016 I started to get chest pains, and me having extreme anxiety thought I had breast cancer, so I ended up going to the doctor where he says it is just heartburns but just in case I will send you for a chest x-ray. Later a doctor gave me constipation medicine because it was because I was constipated that was giving me the chest pains. SO after that I started to get an increase of gas and my stools weren’t proper but I didn’t realize that. Now going into December a week before my headaches start I have an intense pain that strikes for 5 minutes in my jaw. I was at school and was shocked so I ate some Advil and it went away. Then a week after a day before my headaches started, my jaw again had an increase of pain and my neck and shoulders were killing me. I have always had a bad neck and shoulders after I was in an car accident in 2013, so I just thought it was just neck pain, So I ate Aleve and went to sleep, when I woke up BAMM my amazing headachestarted that hasn’t went away and it has been a year. When I woke up my head was pounding, there as so much pressure in my head, and in the face of my head, I was dizzy, imbalanced, felt weird sensations in my head. I freaked out and ate painkillers which to my luck didn’t work and never have for this glorious headache. SO that’s when I starts going to my family doctors she thought it was a sinus infection-nope, she thought it was a cold-nope, then she started to do all these tests on my which where an eye test, sinus x-ray, a painkiller that didn’t work, blood work and everything was negative, so then she sent me to an allergy doctor which was in three months. At that point I was in January and the symptoms were still there. In February I end up going to the ER because I couldn’t take it anymore. The ER gave me a migraine shot, guess what it didn’t work. They then sent me to a neurologist which the appointment was in May so I had to wait 3 months. Then something crazy happened, in March one day my ear was itching really badly so I itch it really badly and the headache and all the symptoms went away, for three weeks. I was in shock I didn’t understand what happened. I went to the allegory doctor and he said oh it must have been viral because none of the symptoms are adding up to an allergy. After, the tree week the headache came back and it had the same symptoms, at that point I just waited out for the neurologist appointment. When we as the neurologist, he was like oh its tension headaches and told me some things to do that didn’t help. He also sent me for a MRI which was in 4 months. So I waited and my symptoms then changed again to a dull pain in my head that I can’t locate it it’s there the pain is now a 5 out of 10 which is manageable but irradiating. So I/ waited for my MRI which was in July and the MRI was clear. Then something else happened the headaches then went away for two week AGAIN! I did nothing, at that time I went to LA to see family. However I was severely constipated which then made me realize oh it might be a stomach issue I am having. I thought this because my digestive system still was out of whack. SO after the headache came back I went to work and investigated on my stomach. I went on diets gluten, low carb, ate vitamins, medication, and nothing has worked. Long story short the headaches are still there I don’t know what to do. My family doctor has given up on me. The headache has been getting worse. What do you guys think I should do? The headaches come don’t leave and then go by themselves for a short time. My parents think I am crazy but I am serious it’s never leaves. Any advice?

label: Headache
discussion_title: Partner becomes ill after kissing / intimacy? - please help
discussion: My girlfriend of 4 years becomes ill after we have french kissed. We don't live together & only see each other at weekends. The symptoms she suffers with are headache (like a band across the top of the head, left-right), eye ache, fatigue/lethargy. Basically, general malaise. The symptoms present themselves 12-24 hours after (or sometimes sooner) we've had intimate contact, but do clear within 24-36 hours later. She believes I may be a carrier of something which passes to her when we kiss (or have close facial contact), triggering her symptoms.We are both in our early 40s & have not experienced this with any previous relationships.Both of us have visited our GPs & undergone blood tests, but they were all clear.The best advice the GPs gave was for her to take painkillers after we'd been in contact.We stopped french kissing approx. 1 year ago to try & alleviate her symptoms. Whilst this has reduced her symptoms it's not great for our relationship!Can anyone offer any advice on what might be causing this & which type of medical professional may be able to help please?

label: Headache
discussion_title: Very uncomfortable headache for the last 2 - 3 months: Please suggest some advice!
discussion: Hi, I am a 17 year old girl who has been experiencing very uncomfortable headaches for the past two to three months. After doing some research I believe they are tension headaches but am not completely sure and would really love some advice on how to relieve these headaches in the short term and prevent them in the long term. So here are some of the things I have been experiencing...- Very uncomfortable feeling near the occipital lobe, frontal lobe and around the sides, feels very tight and like a band squeezing my head. - Pain occasionally continues down the side of my face. - The headaches may be super bad for one week then be only mild another week. - They do not stop me from sleeping. - Pain sometimes gets worse when I look at screens but other times the screens can provide a good distraction from the headache. The headaches do not stop me from doing physical activity or continuing with my academic goals although they are very uncomfortable and do stop me from reaching my full potential. I do not get stressed about my school work (although I am a high achiever), but I have been experiencing anxiety about my headaches. Does this anxiety make the headaches worse? Are there any particular ways I can deal with it? Also not sure if these are important as well...- Two months ago had a swollen lymph node near the ear but swelling has since faded. - My head gets very hot during the day and heats up. - If I place a hand to the side of my head I can feel very distinguishable pounding of blood. I love reading and doing my best and these headaches are stopping me from enjoying these things, as well as participating fully in social and academic actives. If you do have any tips or have experienced these types of headaches before, please provide some relief techniques or the reasons why these headaches are occurring. Thank you so much for your help!Gen

label: Headache
discussion_title: Please help , no doctor seems to know whats wrong with me
discussion: Hi, and thank you in advance.I'm a 35 year old women .About a year ago I started to have these symptoms:- ear pressure.- tongue numbness .- right cheek numbness.- fatigue .All symptoms get worse with a lot of work ( bending over moving around a lot picking up around the house ...)I saw many doctors and specialists and this is what I did so far: - CT scan from neurologists discovered a growth in my brain wasn't sure if its a tumour or calcification ..refered me to a neurosurgeon - cat scan with and without die .. confirmed that it was calcification and said it had nothing to do with my symptoms cause of there location.These are only the last 2 specialists..I saw many other doctors and nothing .Once I was prescribed an antibiotic and that made me feel better for about a month and then it came back.I was given migraine medication and nothing .I was given gabapentin and imitrex nothing worked. My symptoms get so bad that i can't function and i need to lay down.Please help , all ideas r welcome.Sorry about the long post .Thank you .

label: Headache
discussion_title: Headaches/dizzyness
discussion: Hey all..! I'm just after some general advice, or if anyone has been in a similar situation. I wasnt sure which group fit my symptoms best, so I thought perhaps this could be good - as headaches are kind of sometimes resulting in similar symptoms. I'd just like to firstly say that this isn't stressing me too much. I'm trying to be practical! So, my symptoms. I am a 30 year old guy, been pretty healthy. Not overweight, no injuries, eat well, exercise 1-2 hours walking per day etc. Not a stressful job - I'm a tour guide. All these symptoms started only around 5/6 days ago.So, firstly, I feel like I am walking on a trampoline. very strange sensation. I also have slight ringing in my earsAnd visually, my eyesight has changed a bit. I feel like I'm looking through an old tv when it has lost signal - everything is slightly pixelated. I'm also more sensitive to light - I have an impression of shapes for a few seconds of things I have just looked at, particularly in a darkened room. Sometimes if I look at a white wall, it will turn a little yellowy/black, and it will start to "wave" - like the sea.I also have brain fog, and I cant formulate sentences sometimes co-herrently. Although I think that I think okay..! My legs also feel a little weak sometimes.I do have a little shoulder/neck pain.I have had a little jaw pain from biting my teeth, but nothing too bad. The muscles in my cheeks were twitching a couple of weeks ago, and it was hurting a little more then. But it really isnt too bad now. Has anyone had similar symptoms/been medically diagnosed with anything? I've been to the doctors a few times, but they keep saying "maybe you're stressed", and one nurse recommended that I went for physiotherapy on my neck/shoulders - as it could be coming from that. I did also visit a neuralgic doctor, she did all sorts of tests etc, and she seemed 100% convinced that it was NOT neuralgic. I've also had a CT scan done of the brain/skull - everything was fine there, and a xray of my neck - nothing was displaced/irregular in terms of bones. Any helpers or hints at where I could go/what i should do next would be appreciated!I'm not driving at the moment due to this, and I feel generally a little uncomfortable with my eyesight issues. Apart from that I'm a firm believer of "belief".. but only to a point! Thanks anyone/everyone in advance!

label: Headache
discussion_title: Headache for 3 weeks
discussion: Hello,I've been suffering head pressure and a headache ever since 2 days before new years eve. I've tried ibuprofen, excederin, Tylenol and nothing seems to help. I ended up going to the ER for a CT scan that came back normal and the only finding was a 16mm sphenoid cyst on the right. Dr said he thinks I have tension headaches. But I constantly have head pressure, like someone is sitting on my forehead and I had two episodes of vertigo so I'm not sure if that's normal for tension headaches. The pressure gets so bad that my ears pop, I can hear my heartbeat in my left ear, and then my neck gets stiff and hurts. I'm not sure what else to do. Any thoughts on what this could be or anyone else experiencing this? It's making it hard to concentrate while working and sometimes hard falling asleep. Hello,I've been suffering head pressure and a headache ever since 2 days before new years eve. I've tried ibuprofen, excederin, Tylenol and nothing seems to help. I ended up going to the ER for a CT scan that came back normal and the only finding was a 16mm sphenoid cyst on the right. Dr said he thinks I have tension headaches. Any thoughts on what this could be or anyone else experiencing this? It's making it hard to concentrate while working and sometimes hard falling asleep.

label: Headache
discussion_title: Debilitating, constant head sensation - uncomfortable concentrating for 8 weeks
discussion: Hello,Fairly fit and active M/33 here. I have been experiencing a number of symptoms for 8 weeks now that started after a night out where I ate a fair amount of food and drink a few pints of beer (nothing unusual for me).The main debillitating symptom is a constant, dull, uncomfortable sensation in the left side of my head, and this I feel either at my neck or behind my eye or in between. I feel this from the moment I regain full consciousness from waking up (feels like blood or electric rushing to an area in my head), to when I go to sleep. It feels like there is an increase in head pressure.This thing that sets this apart from other people's accounts on this forum is the following. When I am doing nothing, it is bearable. If I try to concentrate, the feeling intensifies. This can be anything from watching tv, reading a book or emails, trying to listen to music, being in a noisy crowd - the more 'facts' or new information in the content/movement, the more uncomfortable it feels, usually to the point were I have to stop/withdraw myself. I usually end up feeling uneasy and with a headache. It feels like I have an extremely low tolerance to stress and/or new information. I would imagine that playing a computer game would be impossible. Composing this forum post has been difficult.When this started, the intensity was low but reached is peak 5 days later where even a few seconds of watching tv was unbearable. 2 weeks later, the intensity reduced, but I haven't felt much improvement since.Other symptoms I have (these are bearable/manageable):Constant tinnitus in right ear and bouts in leftFractured sleepNeed to urinate soon after drinkingSensitivity to loud/high pitched noiseDepersonalisationSocial withdrawalSymptoms I have recovered from thus far:Panic in headPalpitationsFeeling of difficulty breathing as I try to fall asleepCold hands and feetLoss of apititeI find that keeping physically busy takes my mind off the symptom like cleaning, hoovering and having a gym work out. Being a passenger in train/bus/car journeys are now bearable. I cannot drive my car comfortably, so have not made any car journeys alone since. I am unable to work (in IT). My quality of life now is restricted and poor compared to before.I have had a blood test (clear), brain MRI (clear) and have been to see a neurologist who administered an occipital nerve block, but that made no difference - may have made it worse. I am at loss as to what is causing my symptoms and what my outlook is. My gp says to just rest. I am wondering if anyone else is or has experienced this and if they ever got a formal diagnosis of this. I would much appreciate anyone's account of their experience. Many thanks for reading.

label: Headache
discussion_title: 6 weeks headaches, feeling helpless
discussion: I have been suffering from intermittent headaches for 6 weeks. They have been mild headaches predominantly in the temple and occasionally back of the head and haven’t been distracting from my daily activities, the problem is I can’t deal with them which is unusual for me. Usually when I get a headache, as we all do, I’ll take paracetamol and within a couple of hours they are gone. Over the course of the 6 weeks the other two most prominent symptoms has been feeling a pulse in my head, not necessarily when I have a headache and more noticeable when I lie down and consistent nausea. From about 3 weeks I began suffering from neck ache/stiff neck which has developed into neck pain and more recently I have developed aching and weakness in my left wrist and ankle. Having heard a loud, high pitched noise in my head a week ago which I can only describe as something in between a bird chirping and a phone ringing my left ear has been blocked and I have now developed flu like symptoms as well as regularly tasting blood in my mouth. After seeing numerous doctors/consultants nobody seems unduly concerned and have put it down to things from a virus, to tension headaches to a reccurance from disclocating my right shoulder (ac joint) 4 months ago. I have been really worried for a number of weeks that I may have a tumour and seem to have been ticking off a number of potential symptoms, yet no doctor seems the need to do a scan. The symptoms aren’t budging and I’m feeling pretty helpless!

label: Headache
discussion_title: I'm 14 years old and suffer from Chromic cluster headaches.
discussion: I'm a 14 year old girl from england and i have experianced chromic cluster headaches since the ages of 6. This is my first time doing something like this, and i have never spoken to anyone with the same condition as me.When i was younger i used to experiace a hurendous pain my my head my friends just said it was a headace so i tried to carry on with my day but no matter what i couldnt get rid of it, I'm not the kind of person who takes pain killers i just like to fight out the pain usally, cause i don't want my body getting to attached to them, but this time i couldn't bear it i took some pain killers but they didn't work evey time i said i had a headache my mum would just say 'oh take some painkillers and it will go away' but they never did. I never really told anyone about my headaches because i just thought they were normal, because i was only small. As i have grown up they have gotten worse, i now get from arround 8-15 cluster headaches [b:531749f46f] a day [/b:531749f46f] and there was nothing i could do about it so last august i told my mum about them to see if they were normal and she said i should take painkillers wherever i go just incase but my nana being the worry guts she is told me to go to the doctors, so i did and luckily i my GP is a headache specialist and diagnosed me with [i:531749f46f]Chronic[/i:531749f46f] cluster headaches straight away, she said sometimes theycan get confused with migraines and they dont respond to pain killers. So she put me on medication and it doesn't seam to work, it cuts them down so i have from about 5-7 a day insted of the amount i was having before but they dont compltely cut them off. As im writing this i have a headache and i can't think straight. I'm still coming to terms with the fact i am ill, i'm the kind of person that just likes to be the same as everyone else and get treated the same but that's never going to happen and i just have to learn to accept that, but i have such a rare condition that havent spoken to [u:531749f46f]anyone[/u:531749f46f] who's had cluster headaches before, and i just want to have someone to talk to at the end of the day who knows what im going through. 9 months since i was diagnosed i still haven't spoken to anyone. If you have cluster headaches and feel you are alone, please contact me at anytime, i would be happy to talk. label: Headache
discussion_title: Weird fuzzy pressure, headaches
discussion: For about two or three weeks now, I've had a feeling of fuzzy pressure in my head. It doesn't tingle, but it feels like my skull is stuffed with cotton. It's almost akin to wearing a wrap-around headband that's just a little bit too tight. Sometimes it's light and other times it's heavy, but it's on and off throughout the day, and sometimes it develops into a headache later in the day.I have severe anxiety, so of course my immediate thought was "brain tumor, you're going to die dude" and that's really not helping me. I've been cleared by doctors multiple times for digestive problems that felt very very real to me, so it's entirely possible this could be a similar, self-made issue. I keep my hair in a ponytail usually, and taking it out seems to alleviate the pressure a bit, the same with taking off my glasses that slightly press into my temples. I'm not sure if that is really fixing the problem or just making me feel like I've fixed it, but it's certainly doing something, to a degree. The same with straightening my back out when I'm on the computer, since I have to bend my neck downward to look at the screen properly.Any ideas what this could be? I've had headaches on the regular all my life so getting them now is really no big deal, but with all the medical stuff I've been dealing with, I really want to make sure nothing is really wrong with me lest I stew in my own uncontrolled anxiety and make the "symptoms" worse than they otherwise would be.

label: Headache
discussion_title: Post concussion syndrome
discussion: Hello everyone, my names andy & just 5 days ago I banged my head quite badly on a metal display case whilst out with a friend shopping. The corner of the case caught my head quite sharply however there was no bleeding. From how painful it was I expected to get migraine symptoms like the flashing blur across my vision etc. However that didn't happen, I just got pain in the area of the injury.Now the reason I'm posting this is because even after a few days my head still hurts quite badly. I went to my doctors surgery today & told him the whole story. He had a feel of my head & said I hadn't fractured or dented my skull. He said it was good that I wasn't knocked out when the accident happened & its good that I haven't been vomiting. He got out one of those little torch things and tested my eyes which he said were responding normally to light & he checked my blood pressure which was fine. Also the fact that I was able to walk to the doctors surgery all by myself without getting lost or falling over was a good thing.So I have no "red flag" symptoms, I started to worry that I had bleeding on the brain or something crazy like that but apparently I'm good.The doctor said he thinks I have something called Post Concussion Syndrome? I had never heard of it. I have been put on a course of Codeine tablets, 4 a day. (I've only had one so far, so I haven't really felt any better yet.)My doctor guessed that my headache should go within a few days of taking my Codeine, but like always I got home & decided to google the damned thing. I found a lot of sites saying that this post concussion syndrome can last months, possibly a year or two!?!? ...I'm sorry I can't have that. I am only a few weeks away from returning to work after a long battle with my IBD & I can't bear the thought of having a constant headache for so long.If anyone has had this problem please share your experiences & perhaps lend some reassurance my way. I know I should just take onboard what my doctor said, but its too late now I have google-itis thanks,Andy

label: Headache
discussion_title: Extreme headache and neck pain and stiffness from past 5-6 years
discussion: I am a 23 year old male from Mumbai, India.This is a long post, but I am in great suffering. I have been having really bad headaches for a long time (5+ years) and they have been getting worse. I desperately need help, and even after having done MRI and X-Ray, the doctors couldn't find the problem and the general consensus is I have migraine. I have been given medications like Migarid, Naprosyn, Oxidon, Nervup and Zymoflann. They do relieve my headaches a bit, but my problem is not just limited to headaches.Every morning, I wake up with a stiff and painful neck. Soon, I will have a bad headache usually localised to one side and in the temporal area, but then spreads throughtout. As the day progresses, the pain gradually spreads all over my upper body, and I can barely move my neck. The place that hurts most are two points on the base of the skull, some points on my neck and the shoulder. The pain is extreme, and I cannot open my eyes or even sit up. This happens everyday, for more than 5 years. I always have had tinnitus. I have visited the ENT and they confirmed that it was tinnitus (not objective), and had my middle ear checked which came out clear (no problems in middle ear). The static ringing in my ears becomes even louder during my headaches, coupled with a whooshing/sound and pressure; so much that it drowns the outside noise to a great extent.I also find that I am unable to think clearly. I feel my memory is abysmal, and I cannot study anymore no matter how hard I try. There is too much confusion/issues with concentration. At random points in the day, I have a hot cold feeling, especially during a headache. I cannot tolerate loud noise, light, music, cannot laugh, cry, or get excited, since it induces a terrible headache. My muscles fatigue very quickly, and I feel that I have very high sensitivity to pain.My neck feels really really stiff, and becomes really painful during a headache. Also, when I have a headache (or when I become excited/anxious), my stomach becomes upset and I pass excessive amounts of gas. I have observed that my muscles get quickly sore when I used to workout. I wake up every morning tired and my neck extremely sore and in pain.My grades are low, I have trouble remembering things, and at this point, I feel like I have become a "vegetable" that cannot do anything apart from confined to the bed because of the pain. I feel like a very disabled person now. I am becoming more depressed day by day, and I really, really need help urgently.Here are some of my details-Age - 23; Height - 5'8"; Weight - 150 lbs; Race - Indian; Habits - Non-smoker, non-alcoholic, rarely drink coffee; Deficiencies - Had a slight deficiency of Vitamin B12 and Vitamin D earlier; Sleep - 6-7 hours daily. Sleeping more than that may result in headaches. Taking naps at noon results in headaches. I sleep on my back, since sleeping in any other position guarantees a very sore neck and upper back the next morning and multiple days of continuous headache.I have visited countless doctors in India regarding my condition. I have had scans and tests which came out clear. I really don't know what else to do know, and would really appreciate if someone has any idea about what is going on.

label: Headache
discussion_title: My headaches cured!! ??
discussion: Hi all, just wanted to share this as it could hopefully help someone. I have found out that being low in magnesium and b vitamins can cause headaches so started using flax seed which has iron, magnesium and other beneficial minerals etc. Just sprinkle it on cereal, salads, stews, anything basically. My headaches have stopped, something so easy. Taking medication for headches etc can cause this deficiency so it's compounding the problem. Hope this helps some one. Good luck.

label: Headache
discussion_title: I feel there's something wrong with my head.
discussion: Hello. I don't really know what to do or how to solidify a google search for my symptoms so I figured this may be my best bet. I am 18. So I have struggled with anxiety/depression since I was young due to being molested by my neighbor. This particular incident F'd me up for a while and the only reason I am including such information is in case of a possible connection to PTSD with my issue since I have been working through this subject in therapy. Basically, my symptoms are all over my body but now that they are strting to hurt my head I am concerned. Some odd things that have been happening to me for years/months are: hands and feet turning purple and numb, loss of appetite, extreme back and neck pain (it feels both muscular and skeletal in pain). For a few months now I have been feeling EXTREMELY depressed and anxious, to the point where i cry out of frustration at least once a day over it. I feel extremely disconnected from my life and the world around me. For the times when I am actually awake and mentally present, I harbor alot of anger and frustration. I have no reason to be upset, I am more than okay with all aspects of my life and if there are things I am not ok with I have already learned to accept them. However, I have been experiencing extreme heachaches that over power my entire head. I get tingling sensations on the top and towards the back side of my brain. When I stand it gets extremely painful to the point where I CAN'T stand. It feels like my entire brain is expanding and pushing against my skull. All I can do is squeeze my eyes and wait for it to pass. But my entire head feels negative. I don't know how to clearly explain it but it makes me want to crawl out of my skin because my entire head feels encapsulated in negativity (Not in thoughts, but as in physical harm).Also I am experiencing sleeping problems with sleep paralysis and everything that has to do with it. I am completely afraid to sleep alone at this point. I sleep with my boyfriend every night and if he isnt home I have to sleep on the floor of a family member.I feel terrible, miserble, and crazy and I know I shouldn't be feeling any of this as I am usually a smart, healthy, and vibrant person. However due to all of this I only can manage to do the bare minimum in school and work because It feels as if I can't push my brain that far. Any insight is more than appreciated.

I'm scared to death it could be something bad!The pain varies a lot. Sometimes it's very strong and sometimes it's almost nonexistent, but it's always there. I can feel it. Neither of them worked. Just a couple of points now so that you guys can help me better:* I had this same headache about 3 months ago for the first time. It lasted for a week and then went away. Now it came back and is with me for over a month. * I work as a night guard so I get irregular sleep. Sometimes I take naps at work and then when I get home at 6 am I sleep until 10:30 to 11:00 am. (But I've had this job for 2 years and never had this type of headache... so I don't know...)* With my current girlfriend I have had some erection problems... It's 100% psychologically. I know it. But to get my confidence back I took some erectile dysfunction pills. (Sildenafil mainly and tadalafil). But I took a quarter of the recommended dosage and it worked. I still take it a couple of times a week, but I'm trying to get rid of it. It could be it? I don't think so... but anyway...What do you guys think? Should I be worried? Help me!

label: Headache
discussion_title: Pressure in head for 10+ days
discussion: Hello all, I've been experiencing a strange series of feelings in my head for the last 10 days. Its been a bit of a ride so far and frankly I want to get off.I had a few normal headaches around my birthday which was 22nd August but I got on top of them with regular paracetamol. It was then by the 26th August that I had a pressure in my head that was pretty much stuck in my right temple, felt kinda weird but I wouldn't say it "hurt" per se. On Sunday 27th I felt the pressure behind my right eye on and off. At this point I was not taking anymore paracetamol because I was busy with things and just assumed it would go away with rest and drinking water.So we get to Monday 28th August and my head feels super weird, the pressure was radiating from the front to the back of my head all on the right side, never straying into the left side of my head though. There were twangs of pain but it still felt more like pressure than pain.I ended up in the doctors office after a poor nights sleep and a heavy dose of worrying.The doc listened to my story and concluded that I was experiencing a "migraine without aura". She inspected my eyes with a torch thingy and lightly touched around my head with her hands. Doc got it out of me that I was worried about the possibility that I could have a brain tumor and she asked me a series of questions like, Have I been vomiting? Have I been blacking out? Am I losing my memory or vision or hearing? To all of these I answered no. Doc then said that these are all red flag symptoms so I should not worry. She sent me home with pills called Sumatriptan(?). And I was told that I would know if these pills worked after one dose.So there I was that evening I took one of these new pills and nothing happened, but after the second one a couple hours later I got in bed to go to sleep and had a terrible night. I had a real legit pain bouncing around my head from both sides, front and back. i was miserable. Next day I went back to the doctors office with the weight of the world on my head.I saw a doc who I had actually met with before who remembered me from a past ailment which was reassuring. He heard me out and ended up doing a full blown check up. He took my blood pressure, my temperature, he had me do a series of exercises with my hands for my coordination or something, he turned off the lights and got out a torch for my eyes, and he felt all around my head and neck. All the while he was asking me questions without a breath in between so that i had no time to think about the answers.When he was finished he sat down across from me and said that my head problems were due to tension. So I obviously started asking questions. The whole "migraine without aura" was now debunked. This doctor who had met me before knew that I was a worrier so he went through the whole brain tumor possibility with me. He was pretty damn confident that I don't have one for the same reasons that I had been told the day before and he thought it was very unlikely that I would start to experience these red flag symptoms.I was somewhat reassured having had a full check up and a rather comprehensive discussion about everything. I was told to go home and take co-codamol "for a week or so" that was my doctors words, and to work on relaxation techniques, maybe use a heat pack on my neck or take hot showers or baths.From that evening when I got home, which was Friday 1st September, I have been taking 2 co-codamol about every 4 hours everyday. I have done my best to try and relax and be optimistic, I have also stayed off the internet looking for answers. I am still worried though deep down. My head has gone back to feeling like I have a concentrated pressure above and a little behind my right ear, sort of to the right of the back of my head. Its as if someone is pressing on my head in that spot. I have noticed a few times now and then that I will struggle to think of the word i mean to say, but that could be because I am so distracted by my head. I also have floaters in my eyes but i have had these for years. A few times I have had a sudden ringing in one of my ears but i have heard this in both ears at different times, but this could also be because of how much i listen to music at a loud volume.....Yesterday; 3rd September, I woke up and felt as if my head was better, I was happy to feel like this suddenly, until I got up and started to do things to find that my head was still mad with me. I am still taking co-codamol every four hours but it doesnt seem to actually do much. I am keeping hydrated as much as i can and I am still eating albeit not as much as i normally do, which is a classic trait of mine when I am nervous and worried.This morning (4th September) I felt as though my head was ok when i initially woke up, just a bit delicate maybe, but as i got up and had breakfast my head is definitely still feeling weird. I have that pressure at the back right side of my head, I wouldn't say it hurts, just pressure. I'm on my first co-codamol of the day, gonna have my second dose soon. I'm not sure wether or not to go back to my doctor or try to soldier on and see what happens.....

label: Headache
discussion_title: Morning Headaches
discussion: Hi, I'm a 30 yr old woman and I wondered if anyone is suffering similar headaches and what they have done to try and combat them. For the past few months Im being awoken from sleep in the morning with a severe headache this is predominantly in the side of my head (whichever side I was sleeping on) the degree of severity heightens the more I have slept. Once I get up the pain moves and feels like a crushing weight on the top of my skull along with pain at the base of my skull with my neck and down my spine to about my shoulder blades feels stiff and aches. Gradually my spine and neck pain/stiffness wear off and the headache lessens to a bearable level after an hour or so. Sometime I can have the head pain for several hours even after pain killers and adequate hydration. This is becoming the norm but I feel constantly exhausted by the headaches and long to wake up with no pain in my head. Is there anything I can do to prevent these headaches or any tips on how to alleviate the symptoms more efficiently and effectively. discussion_title: Working Night Shift And Getting Headaches
discussion: Hello All,I started working on the night shift back in November. (About 3 months now) The first few weeks were normal but then I started getting headaches. Also it would get harder and harder to sleep. I started taking melatonin 3mg and that has helped with my sleep alot thank god on the days that I work. However when it comes time for my days off (2 days off consecutively) I tend to get headaches when I go to sleep at night and wake up in the morning. Most times its on the right side of my head, temples. Sometimes it travels to the left or top of my head. I went to a neurologist and due to my blood pressure past she ruled it out to that being the reason. However my blood pressure has now been regulated and I still get them.Long story short during the days I work i dont get headaches and using melatonin I can sleep. During the days im off I try not to use melatonin and I get headaches either when I wake up or later on through the day. Does anyone have any advice on what it could be? I go for an MRI in a few weeks so I can rule out any serious conditions. Anything will help I just want to have peace of mind that this isnt anything life threatening.

label: Headache
discussion_title: Worried about headaches
discussion: Hi all,I'm a nineteen-year-old girl, and I've been experiencing headaches for over a week now. The first morning, a throbbing headache woke me up - it throbbed right at the back of my skull, and the pain was severe. However, I started my period that day, so I attributed it to hormones. However, I've finished my period now, and I'm still getting them. The symptoms are as follows: - I always wake up with one. It's dull, and it doesn't wake me, but I'm aware it's there.- It's off-and-on. I'll get it at least four times a day for around half an hour. - It's at the back of my head, and feels dull and achy. Often my head feels tight. Sometimes it moves around my head, like my scalp is being pulled, or something. Sometimes it feels toothachy in my temples. I must add that I have Generalised Anxiety Disorder, so it could be that, because sometimes my neck aches, too. But I'm honestly terrified I have a brain tumour. if I think about it too much, I feel nauseous and dizzy - and I know these are both symptoms of anxiety and a tumour. I suppose I just need reassurance, or a way to combat them - when I think I feel calm, they'll sometimes come on. I don't know whether it's just subconscious stress, or what....

label: Headache
discussion_title: Head pressure meditation
discussion: Hi everyone, I was foolish enough to think and believe in things that I saw in media that meditation is good so I developed habit to meditate using guided meditations on youtube for over a year ,maybe more. In the beginning I was really feeling good and had nice results from my practice and then strong head pressure occurred and remains in my head for nine months.I am absolutely certain that is consequence of meditation , I came across hundreds of people suffering same problems of meditation on internet . The problem is that if I go to forums where are people who meditate and share same problems I get mystical explanations like purifying chakras but I really have to find way out of this.You can’t even imagine what have I tried. I did various medical checks such as MRI and EGG which turned out to be fine.I also visited many neurologists, I even spoke with guy who was candidate for Nobel prize in neurosciences who told me that this is no consequence of meditation and that I should reduce stress. I have been to chiropractic, craniosacral therapy three times, acupuncture, Reiki, massages you name it . I started with Qigong classes , I can't even remember what else this I tried.. I went also to psychiatrist well known one who first thought it was anxiety so she gave me pills for that that didn't work , second guess was that I am imagining it and she gave pills for psychosis which of course didn't work as well .Eventually she gave me antidepressants that didn't work as well and sent me to bioenergist who didn't help as well .Then I changed psychiatrist who change medicine and I went through hell , pills put me down and I was throwing up every morning and couldn't sleep. I gave up on that and started Ayurveda medicine that didn't work so I stopped that as well. I recently met Russian millionaire who told me that he is owner of several clinics in Russian and that his daughter had suffered from migraines for seven years and they have been to various doctors from US to Japan and eventually Iranian guy here in Serbia helped her, next morning I was in his office. He gave me bunch of cocktails for 500 euros and I all I got was 3 kilos because his pills were full of vitamin B. Next is I am seeing guy who has developed machine based on Tesla's idea that measure frequency although I have been to quantum medicine with failure as well . The worst is that in moments of desperation my father took to shaman who told me that I am under magic , I never felt so stupid and humiliated in my life. Please help I don’t know what to do more

label: Headache
discussion_title: Lumbar puncture headache
discussion: Good afternoon. Two days ago I had a lumbar puncture performed by my neurologist. Procedure itself went off without a hitch. About an hour later I started having a really bad headache in the back of my head. It mostly went away when I laid down. I understand this is not uncommon. I was told to lay down, drink plenty of fluids, and take caffeine. Friday night I woke up in middle of the middle of the night in absolute agony - worst pain I ever felt in my life. Pain was shooting down the back of my neck into both of my arms. This lasted for about a half hour. Thankfully it eased up and I managed to fall asleep again. Saturday morning I felt somewhat better ( was able to stand up and go to the bathroom for the first time without pain), but by mid afternoon, I had to remain entirely in bed to avoid really bad headaches. Saturday night again I had a brief bout of insane pain. Sunday morning I felt well enough to actually take a shower, but again by mid afternoon, I find myself back in bed again, unable to stand up for more than a few seconds. The whole time I have been taking Tylenol and caffeine, which doesn't seem to be helping much. Each time I think I'm getting better, I end up relapsing. My neurologist said that if I don't feel better by Sunday night, I should consider going back to the emergency room, though she cautioned they're not going to run to do a blood patch so quickly. Is this something that can resolve itself on its own? I really would rather not have to go back to the hospital, but I don't know how much longer I can handle this pain.

label: Headache
discussion_title: Too many doctors with no answers
discussion: My headaches started around February and towards the beginning, I was continually diagnosed with a sinus infection by my PCP. I was given antibiotics for a week with no progress. I then went back and was given the strongest antibiotic they had for two weeks with still no relief. Then they gave me Prednisone for a week but I was only able to take it for a couple days before stopping due to the side effects. Since then the headache has been ever constant sometimes worse than others. I then went to an ENT who wanted a CT scan of the sinuses which showed a little swelling but nothing that he thought would cause the headache. I then went to a neurologist who wanted a CT of the Brain which showed nothing. Then I had an MRI which showed nothing. I'm currently taking Nortriptyline which is not helping in the slightest. My headaches seem to be closest in description to tension headaches but with an almost ever present lightheadedness sort of dizziness that has kept me from driving sense about April. I feel like I'm out of options because I am at a loss for answers.My headaches started around February and towards the beginning, I was continually diagnosed with a sinus infection by my PCP. I was given antibiotics for a week with no progress. I then went back and was given the strongest antibiotic they had for two weeks with still no relief. Then they gave me Prednisone for a week but I was only able to take it for a couple days before stopping due to the side effects. Since then the headache has been ever constant sometimes worse than others. I then went to an ENT who wanted a CT scan of the sinuses which showed a little swelling but nothing that he thought would cause the headache. I then went to a neurologist who wanted a CT of the Brain which showed nothing. Then I had an MRI which showed nothing. I'm currently taking Nortriptyline which is not helping in the slightest. My headaches seem to be closest in description to tension headaches but with an almost ever present lightheadedness sort of dizziness that has kept me from driving sense about April. I feel like I'm out of options because I am at a loss for answers.

label: Headache
discussion_title: Persistent daily headache and other symptoms
discussion: Hey everyone, I'm new here and I've been wanting to hear opinions regarding headaches. I'm a 25 yo woman, healthy, I don't smoke or drink. I remember having headaches ever since I was a kid, ever since always taking OTC meds trying to control it. Three years ago I had a CT scan that came back clear and the doctor started treating me for migraine. Ever since I took different kinds of meds but I've never been more than 2/3 days headache free. In the last months I've been having daily headaches, my exception is when I'm not in pain. A new neurologist explained how migraine works and how he hardly thinks my case is migraine related, as my headaches are often in the same spot and they happen everyday. I'm having other symptoms that I don't know if are somehow related, such as lots of heartburn, difficulty in finding some words when I'm speaking, fatique and sleeppiness, rapid hearbeat sometimes even when I'm resting, these are some that I can remember of - overall speaking, I don't feel well all the time, this symptoms are really having a direct impact in my everyday life, specially at work. I'm kind of afraid of what this pain can be. Now I have a MRI and a QEEG Brain Mapping. I'm curios to hear if any of you suffered something along these lines and if you have a diagnosis to share with me.

label: Headache
discussion_title: Headache everyday for a week+
discussion: Hey everyone! I'm 24, I've been having a headache everyday since June 18th. My diet is on point, I'm fit, I sleep well and I and excercised regularly until I started getting headaches. I don't drink or smoke, I never even smoked once in my life. I'm a gamer and stay a lot in front of the PC.How it all started: I went to a gaming event nearby on the 18th, had to wake up early to catch the bus, slept only around 4hrs, didn't eat enough and I was walking around the event the entire day from like 8 AM to 7 PM. I ate some bad sandwich there and was in the WC for 20 mins. I didn't even use transport that much, I walked back home even when I was feeling terrible, I don't know why, I'm so dumb. I'm pretty sure I covered an insane distance.When I came home all my legs and arms were sore, my pulse was 100+ while lying down (usually its 60), had a terrible headache as if I was really drunk the night before and was feeling cold (I never feel cold). The day after that I still had that terrible headache, my pulse was almost back to my normal condition - 75 or so. I didn't stay on the computer at all these 2 days.The next day I was completely fine and since I was so confident with my physical condidition [I've been working out for 3-4 months now extensively (calisthenics + cardio) and I'm honestly pretty fit] I thought its a good idea to play 29 games in a row (that average 20 mins each). So I essentially played all day without much breaks. The game I play is really competitive and requires a lot of concentration since it's kind of like real time chess, so I stressed my brain probably even more than your average guy that just plays for fun. I got a terrible headache again and had trouble falling asleep.Since then I've had the same annoying mild headache every day. I'm really scared that I might've unlocked some condition. I know that what I did was retarded. I tend to overtrain from time to time, I overtrained like 3 times total in 4 months.I'm honestly super annoyed that I keep having to deal with stuff like this even though my diet is perfect, I excercise regularly and I don't drink or smoke... I read that these things can be genetic too, some people are more prone to it etc. I'm pretty sure it has to be that because I have friends that are super unhealthy and don't have to deal with that...It just feels so unfair to see friends or acquintances that go out partying every night, barely get any sleep, drink alcohol, smoke and have almost no problems while I have to deal with stuff like this time and time again even though I have an almost perfect lifestyle (besides staying in front of the PC too much)I'm thinking of going to my GP to ask about his thoughts on the matter but I've honestly lost faith in doctors. A few months ago I had problems with high pulse and I was prescribed betablockers and it took so much work to get rid of that poison and get in good shape on my own. I'm scared they will prescribe me some shXXXy medication that I will have to fight with again.Gaming has been my job for the last 5-6 years and I don't really have much else to fall back on. I'm also scared that I might have to give up on it cause honestly I don't think there's much else that I can change in regards to my diet, sleeping patterns etc. I even eat homegrown food. :DWhat should I even do ? Do I get some brain scans or what?Thanks for reading this wall of text ! I hope I wasn't too annoying. :D I'll put time in researching some of the threads here too.Moderator comment: I have edited this post due to the swearing. These are open forums so as per the T&Cs please do not use offensive language in posts otherwise they may be deleted.

label: Headache
discussion_title: Headaches for 8 months please help!
discussion: Hi my name is Blair and I'm a junior in high school. At the beginning of this school year (September 11th to be exact), I started getting headaches. After about a week I told my mother and she took my to a walk in clinic. The dr told me I had a sinus infection which made sense because I also felt pressure in my face and had a stuffy nose. I took the medicine she prescribed for the 10 days but it did not help. I went to my pediatrician a week after and she prescribed me more medicine that did not help. Eventually (after being put on several other medicines that made me sick including an extremely high dosage of prednesone) my nose cleared up but my headache was still there. Since September I've had a headache every day at different intensities. I've gone to 4 pediatricians, 3 emergency rooms, an ENT, a dentist (I now have TMJ and have a bite guard for my teeth), Orthodontist, Eye Doctor, Chiropractor, and a neurologist. The chiropractor helped me a lot at first but now it seems like it's not doing much. I've had a CT scan that came out clean and just got an MRI and MRV done and am waiting for the result. I am not sure if I have chronic headaches or if there is something obvious that everyone's missing!! My headaches seem to stress from the back of my head and go to the front of it. My cheeks are also very sensitive and hurt often. Loud noise intensifies the pain too. There were many times were I couldn't get out of bed. Also, I am a long distance runner and was forced to stop running about 3 months ago because I was not able to function properly. My grades are slipping In school and I am having difficultly doing simple tasks and concentrating. Usually I am happy and full of energy but now I am exhausted, weak, and have anxiety. Please help me if you have any ideas or thoughts . Thank you guys so much!! -BlairHi my name is Blair and I'm a junior in high school. At the beginning of this school year (September 11th to be exact), I started getting headaches. After about a week I told my mother and she took my to a walk in clinic.
